title: Interview: Alden Penner
body:
How time flies.

Yesterday marked the release of Exegesis, Alden Penner’s debut album as a solo artist that [we covered back in January](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/25929-news-alden-penner-announces-debut-album/). You can stream the full release below or download it from iTunes [here](https://itunes.apple.com/ca/album/exegesis/id811478393 "Alden Penner Exegesis 2014").

Recorded mainly at Alden’s Mile End home with help from co-producer Laura Crapo, some of the guitar tracks on Exegesis were recorded in Arcade Fire’s ([now former](http://www.theguardian.com/music/2013/jan/21/arcade-fire-recording-studio)) church studio in Farnham.

Seeing [Erik Leijon](https://twitter.com/eleijon) had already done a great job of a long-form interview with Alden for the [Montreal Gazette](http://www.montrealgazette.com/Alden+Penner+writes+chapter+same+book/9463230/story.html), I wanted to interview him in a way that was more representative of how his music feels to me – minimal, artistic and pure. So I told Alden to let it flow and we settled on the following:
